column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$5$On and off
column3: Mostly on for 3 or so years. 1stly
column4: effects were noticed by others before noticed by myself. Weight loss due to loss of appetite and then mild weight gain once I started feeling a little more care free. This 'drug' definitely helped with my anxiety. It made me overall very positive. Not 100% better but way more bearable. Helped with getting angry. All was great until I started to continuously notice this lack of empathy
column5: cloudiness In what felt like my frontal lobe
column6: my sex drive severely dropped
column7: and then this major suicidal depression came like a freight train for some reason. Honestly It bummed me out but I knew getting off it was for the better. Now that I have been off of it for a few months
column8: I like the natural feeling better. I think. My anxiety is back but I feel like I can deal with it better. My thoughts come easier. My memory is better.. It feels more 'real.'  However I still have a depressing cloud that lingers over me But SO much better then what was happening to me towards the end. I miss not getting angry so easy and the ease of having positive thoughts. However Im hoping that this experience has helped me learn how to balance things on my own without the help of a prescription. Overall it 'worked great
column9: ' My dosage might have needed to be changed. It could be the stressful but Im confident that being off medication is more the type of life I wanna live.

column1: 16$Condition: Posttraumatic Stress Syndrome$7/28/2018 4:10:34 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$5$3$I am somewhat happy with the medication Citalopram HBR 20MG which I have recently been increased to 30MGs. I used to work in corrections
column2: but now work as a security officer. However
column3: whilst working security March 15
column4: 2015 in an apartment complex
column5: I was lured into the parkade due to a fire alarm where 6 men were waiting for Me. I have since suffered from night terrors
column6: but refused to be a victim so I returned to work for 1 year
column7: then the depression
column8: anxiety
column9: and suicidal thoughts came. Workers comp had Me see a PTSD Psychologist right after the attack for 2 visits
column10: then had Me see him again. He diagnosed Me with delayed onset post traumatic stress
column11: however WCB will only look at the physical aspects of the attack
column12: not the psychological ones. I have now voluntarily been admitted to the psych ward due to wanting to end My life and the Psychiatrist here has put Me on Citalopram. The night terrors have not stopped at all
column13: but I've learned a new coping method by looking for something particular in the room (like My chair) as a grounding to let Me know that I am not at work and the attack is not real. Since taking the 30 Mg of Citalopram the thoughts of ending my life have ceased greatly. Iind myself a lot happier

column1: The only ""negative"" side effect is extremely low sex drive (on a scale of 1 to 10

column3: considering how life is now worth living
column4: I hardly even care! You probably can't understand unless you've experienced it...

column1: For people just starting to take Celexa (or Citalopram)
column2: I suggest starting with no more than 10 mg in the morning. Don't take it at night! The side effects I experienced by starting off with 20 mg at night might not have been caused by the medication (according to my doctor)
column3: but I suggest that you take no chances: start in the morning with or after breakfast. Keep in mind that there is a light at the end of the tunnel
column4: and it is NOT a train coming at you!"

column3: not depression. Worked well for that and social anxiety. This drug is a definite killer of one's sex life. After 12 years or so of taking
column4: I decided to try and get off this drug. My 1st attempt was a disaster thanks to my doctor at the time telling me ""just quit taking""
column5: not gradually decrease. Never
column6: ever try it this way. I have since then been fired him. My main advice for those attempting withdrawal is to do so in a gradual
column7: well-managed way. Keep a record as to when you start
column8: how you feel day by day
column9: any unusual occurrences. I started with a 1/2 tab decrease for a week
column10: then 1/4 for another week
column11: and finally 1/4 every other day for the final week. I still can hardly believe I am free of this drug
column12: but I am and my life is much better for it. The key is to slowly step it down. "

column1: 1000$Condition: Other$9/13/2009 10:19:28 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$5$Doctor prescribed after going to the hospital 3 times for chest tightness and pain in the sternum area...after ruling out all serious conditions the only thing they could find was a Hiatel hernia with acid refux which I constantly worried about so he started me on Xanax .5mg 4 times a day and 20mg of citalopram once a day. I stopped worrying but did have side effects once I stopped the xanax that included dry mouth
column2: heavy sweating in arm pits
column3: blurred vision in left eye
column4: tingle sensations in hands and feet
column5: pounding heart beat which would pulse in head as I slept at night
column6: dizziness
column7: lightheaded
column8: and decreased sexual sensation. (could climax just take longer..too long) also felt tired throughout the day even after stopping the xanax so I switched to taking at night which helped. side effects improved or I got used to them and continued taking for 5 months but never really felt like I needed it as I was still having my original problem and once convinced it was not something serious I felt like I could handle things without drugs so I tapered off too 10mg for two weeks then stopped. (doctor wanted me to stay on it until December) On about day 4 of stopping I started feeling severe lightheadedness almost feel kinda drunk and it has not stopped yet (7th day) I have considered taking xanax again until this stops but have not yet (been toughing it out) very scaring feeling wish I never took this drug and just want to feel normal again. I would rather have worry and pain than this. seeing a surgeon next week to hopefully fix hernia and put all my worries behind.

column6: lots of energy
column7: no weight gain.

column1: MY EXPERIENCE: My anti-depression prescription ran out and I lost my insurance. column2: long story) and tapered myself off (the non-generic Celexa was very expensive.)

column1: Recently and after a case of the shingles

column3: and an inner ear infection that took away my equilibrium...

column1: Some family members sat me down and told me they were very concerned that stress and depression were ruining my health and for what might happen to me...

A-D's are serious drugs and can have serious side effects

column3: run back to your Dr and change something. I have a family member who had to go through 4 different drugs before the 5th one did the trick"

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"THis is an Update to an earlier post:

column1: The drug has helped me out a lot. I have been able to read and understand the self help and self improvement books. The side effects are minimal from what I experienced in the beginning. I am tired and I do have more head aches
column2: but they are not bad ones. I have keept to 10mg and have not increased my dose to the full amount of 20. Though I do notice that I get a bit shakey and my eyesight seems a little fuzzy at times. I have started to feel down or cry
column3: but now I am able to think why I am feeling the way I do. I am able to turn my mood around before it gets worse. When I do find my mood is getting worse
column4: I can now reason with myself and look at the brighter side of every situation. It has helped me be more understanding
column5: helped me stop yelling and helped me be more calm. I don't experience the Road Rage and am able to be more in control. Once I feel that my situation is changing or better than it was before. I will consult my doctor on how to get myself off of this
column6: as I don't want it to become  a perminanat crutch for my mental health.

column2: but it hasn't gone away.    "

column2: though
column3: that different life events moderate the effects of the drug rendering it less effective.  During more stressful times in life
column4: you may find the medications effectiveness drop
column5: but I saw this to be expected.

column1: I did find that the medication made me far less moody and less agitated by ""the little things.""  I am a self-diagnosed obsessive-compulsive and I find it difficult to concentrate in disorganized environments or a room that is in disarray.
One last thing: After being out of country and suddenly running out of the medication (under highly stressful conditions)
column2: I experience what I could only describe as a persistent anxiety attack.  I would highly advise patients to ensure they have ample supply when traveling abroad!

1226$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/23/2009 5:15:56 PM$Reviewer: tskittin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$Had no effect on my anxiety and in fact my PTSD symptoms started coming back. Even with my Ambien I have experienced sleep problems. I experienced most all the side effects and have been extremely sick since first I started this medication and my illnesses got worse.  Have been in ER a couple of times with all the symptoms this medicaiton has, but, since I didnt really read the serious side effects I had no clue I personally should not take this medication with other medications I have. A friend suggested today I look at not only serious side effects but drug interactions and after2 1/2 months of ER doctors running all kinds of tests and coming up negative and my doctor treating me for bronchitis but not paying attention to my other complaints I have had the following serious drug interactions as noted under the tab of interactions with other drugs Tell your doctor immediately if any of these rare but very serious side effects occur: stomach pain, fainting, bloody/black/tarry stools, vomit that looks like coffee grounds, easy bruising/bleeding, muscle weakness/cramps, seizures, fast/irregular/pounding heartbeat, difficulty urinating, change in the amount of urine.  I have fainted once in my life years ago...but 2 weeks ago when she increased my dosage a few nights later I fainted...I thought for no reason at all!  I take Lorazepam and Ambien for over 5 years and evidently this drug does NOT interact well for me.  I also have had Vicodin due to the pain from the coughing from the bronchitis along with OTC cough syrups and Theraflu type medications. I HIGHLY suggest you pay much attention to side effects and drug interractions PRIOR to agreeing to take this antidepressant!

I am much more confident in myself, and can speak up for myself, and talk with a clear mind. Before the medication I could barely hold a conversation without having an anxiety attack. I started to do more things that I enjoy, and do them without needing a friend by my side. I could barely go to the bodega by myself, I was so panicky. I love the way I am now, and feel that things will only get better!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$2$5$I have been on Citalopram for two years.  I was just okay.  Most of my family is on Prozac for depression.  I would like a medication to make me feel better 80% of the time and not feel just okay for 65% of the time.  There was at the start a stomach issue; where I felt that I was going to throw up and then it disappeared just as quickly as it came.  Through the course it did subside.  I feel it is a good standard medication
